bibl.title: Letter from Merritte W. Ireland to Emilie Lawrence Reed, July 23, 1929

div1.p: Ireland expresses admiration for Emilie Lawrence Reed and Walter Reed.

div1.head: Letter from Merritte W. Ireland to Emilie Lawrence Reed, July 23, 1929
div1.opener:
mwi ell
WAR DEPARTMENT
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
WASHINGTON
July 23, 1929.
My dear Mrs. Reed:
div1.p:
I received your nice letter while Mrs.
Ireland and I were on a Western trip. As you
probably remember this is the first time that
Mrs. Ireland has ever gone with me. She enjoyed
every minute of the time, but the greatest joy
we had during our entire trip was the note I
received from you telling me that someone had
made it possible for you to live in comfort the
rest of your life.

If I did anything to make this possible I
am glad of it, but I want to assure you that
whatever I did was a labor of love for a former
member of my Corps and for you. After all I
played but a very very small part in the whole
transaction.

Let us know when you return to Washington
so Mrs. Ireland and I can come to see you.
With all sorts of good wishes,
div1.closer:
Faithfully yours, M. W. Ireland Mrs. Walter Reed,
Blue Ridge Summit,
Pa.
